detailed_info.name: Xanthan Gum
detailed_info.description:
Xanthan gum is used in cosmetics as an emulsion stabilizer, film-forming agent or binder. It is obtained by the fermentation of a carbohydrate (for example glucose) with the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris. It is authorized in Bio.

A 2016 study of the Cosmetic Ingredient Review (CIR) on microbial polysaccharide gums, of which Xanthan gum is a part, concludes that the ingredient is safe.

Note that Xanthan gum is not regulated in Europe. In the United States, the FDA limits its use to 6% of the total ingredients in cosmetics.
detailed_info.reference: CIR - Safety Assessment of Microbial Polysaccharide Gums as used in cosmetics (2016) - https://online.personalcarecouncil.org/ctfa-static/online/lists/cir-pdfs/PR611.pdf
